title: Discord shuts down AI chatbot Clyde
originSummary: Discord is discontinuing its AI chatbot Clyde, effective December 1st.
Users will no longer be able to chat with Clyde in direct messages, group messages, or server chats.
The reason for Clyde's deactivation is unclear, but there is speculation that it may return as a paid feature or that Discord has gathered enough insights from its testing period.

title: Opinion: Biden's Executive Order on AI Falls Short on Addressing Key Issues
originSummary: President Biden's recent executive order on AI aims to establish best practices and standards for AI models.

However, the order overlooks two critical issues: the liability loophole provided by Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, which could hinder efforts to combat deep fakes and misinformation on social media platforms, and one-sided terms of service agreements that enable unethical practices.
To ensure effective regulation of AI, these loopholes must be addressed, and mechanisms for enforcement and legal liability need to be established.

title: U.S. and China's Battle Over AI Persists, Despite Biden-Xi Meeting
originSummary: Tech leaders in the US are optimistic about improving US-China relations, as it reduces risks to their businesses and supply chains.
The issue of control over advanced AI technology remains unresolved, as the US has implemented export controls on computer chips critical for AI development due to national security concerns.

Despite discussions between Presidents Biden and Xi on AI, the US has maintained its stance on export controls, which has become increasingly significant as AI technology is widely adopted by companies and governments globally.

title: Argentina's Presidential Election: AI Takes Center Stage
originSummary: The presidential election in Argentina is being used as a testing ground for the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in political campaigns.
Candidates Sergio Massa and Javier Milei have utilized AI-generated images and videos to promote themselves and launch attacks against each other.

The widespread use of AI in the campaign has raised concerns about disinformation and voter deception, prompting discussions about potential regulations to address the use of AI in political ads and online content.

title: Google's Dream Track generates songs sung by voice clones of famous artists
originSummary: Google has introduced an AI tool called Dream Track that can produce original songs in the style of well-known singers.
Users can input prompts and receive short song clips performed by voice clones of artists like Charlie Puth and T-Pain.
The project, currently in its pilot phase and accessible only on YouTube Shorts, involves collaboration with nine recording artists.

title: Using AI to Generate Hypotheses and Find Research Blind Spots
originSummary: AI is being utilized in scientific research to generate hypotheses and pinpoint areas of knowledge that have been overlooked.
By analyzing existing data and literature, AI systems can propose new connections and discoveries, particularly in fields like drug discovery and genetics.

Researchers are also exploring AI's potential in brainstorming and generating broad hypotheses, as well as using robotic systems for experimentation. However, challenges remain in creating AI systems that can reason about the physical world and integrate scientific knowledge. Open data and automated hypothesis generation are viewed as crucial elements in advancing AI's impact in scientific research.

title: AI's Energy Consumption Concerns Echo Bitcoin Mining Criticisms
originSummary: Heatbit founder, Alex Busarov, claims that Bitcoin miners have more expertise in Bitcoin mining than the AI and machine learning industry.
Busarov predicts that AI computing may face criticisms similar to Bitcoin mining because of its high energy consumption.
He suggests that combining home mining with other functions, such as heating and cooling, can potentially lead to zero energy costs in the future.

title: Sen. Welch Calls for AI Access for Vt. Farmers
originSummary: Senator Peter Welch from Vermont addressed the potential applications of artificial intelligence (AI) in agriculture during a Senate Agriculture Committee hearing.
He raised concerns about the challenges that smaller farmers may encounter in adopting costly AI technology and emphasized the importance of making it accessible and affordable for them.
Senator Welch also acknowledged the potential of AI in improving soil health and suggested exploring its applications in this area.

title: Billionaires Split on AI Stocks: Palantir Gains, Snowflake and Intel Sold
originSummary: The Motley Fool is a financial services company offering investing advice and resources since 1993.
The article discusses the interest of billionaire investors in AI stocks, with a particular focus on Palantir Technologies.
Other AI companies, such as Snowflake and Intel, have seen a decrease in interest from billionaires due to performance and growth concerns.
